definition: to be evenly matched/to meet one's match
chess/chess-like game/a game of chess/CL:盤|盘[pan2]/chess piece/CL:個|个[ge4],顆|颗[ke1]
variant of 棋[qi2]
variant of 棋[qi2]
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: When a general meets a worthy opponent, he won't dare to underestimate him.
sentences.chinese: 棋逢对手难相胜，将遇良才不敢骄。

sentences.english: The ball match this afternoon must be fantastic for diamond cut diamond.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午的球赛棋逢对手，一定很精彩。

sentences.english: The afternoon match is a diamond cut diamond, it must be wonderful.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午的球赛棋逢对手，一定很精彩。

sentences.english: The runners were a good match and ran a very close race.
sentences.chinese: 赛跑选手们棋逢对手，比赛非常激烈。

sentences.english: The well-matched tennis players fought a long, close battle.
sentences.chinese: 两名棋逢对手的网球选手打了一场势均力敌的长仗。

definition: see 棋逢對手|棋逢对手[qi2 feng2 dui4 shou3]
evenly matched (idiom)
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
see 惺惺惜惺惺[xing1 xing1 xi1 xing1 xing1]
lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
not to know one's place
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
sharply opposed to each other, with neither prepared to give an inch (idiom)
battle of wits
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
destiny will make enemies meet (idiom)/(often said about lovers who have a disagreement)
pinyin: bu4 shi4 yuan1 jia1 bu4 ju4 tou2

definition: clash that leaves both sides shattered
lit. heroes usually agree (idiom); Great minds think alike.
pinyin: ying1 xiong2 suo3 jian4 lu:e4 tong2
